descriptor.name: Kerala Distress Relief Fund (Medical) Application Guide
descriptor.short_desc: Learn to assist differently-abled individuals in Kerala in applying for a one-time grant for medical treatment through the SUNEETHI portal.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This course explains the 'Distress Relief Fund for the Differently Abled' offered by the Kerala Government's Social Justice Department. Agents will learn how to guide eligible differently-abled persons with low income through the online application process to receive financial aid for medical treatments, including surgery.

  1. Financial Aid Details:
    Understand the scheme's benefit of a one-time financial assistance of ₹5,000 per person per year, sourced from the interest of a government corpus fund.
  2. Strict Eligibility Criteria:
    Master the specific eligibility rules, including being a Kerala resident, the very low annual income ceilings (₹20,000 Rural, ₹22,375 Urban), and the recognized categories of disabilities.
  3. SUNEETHI Portal Application:
    Learn the detailed, multi-step online application process on the SUNEETHI portal, covering one-time registration, profile creation, document uploads, and final submission.

Why Take This Course:

  • Provide critical support to vulnerable individuals in need of urgent medical funding.
  • Specialize in a key state-level health and welfare scheme for the differently-abled.
  • Become proficient in navigating the SUNEETHI online service portal for efficient application processing.
